intro: Bidens longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stem is erect and branched. Bidens longistyla is typically found in moist habitats such as wetlands and stream banks.
